subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for a licence for 4 months, an amount equal to 35% of the appropriate licence fee prescribed in Schedule 2 and an additional fee of $30. (L.N. 96 of 1985)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: An application under subregulation (1) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the name, address, e-contact means and identity document number of the registered owner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by the original or a copy of the owner’s identity document; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: be accompanied by—

subparagraph.content: documentary proof of a policy of insurance in respect of the vehicle in the name of the owner that is valid on the date on which the licence takes effect; or
any other information or document specified by the Commissioner that enables the Commissioner to be satisfied that there is such a policy of insurance. (L.N. 140 of 2024)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: If the Commissioner is not satisfied with the copy of any document mentioned in subregulation (1A)(b) or (c), the Commissioner may require the registered owner to produce the original of the document. (L.N. 140 of 2024)

An application under subregulation (1) must be signed by the registered owner of the motor vehicle or by some person duly authorized by the registered owner in writing, and where the registered owner is a body corporate the application must be signed by a person nominated by the body corporate. (L.N. 140 of 2024)

Notwithstanding anything contained in subregulation (1), if a valid vehicle licence issued in respect of a motor vehicle in any particular class is surrendered to the Commissioner and at the same time an application under subregulation (1)(a) is made for the licensing of that vehicle in a different class, the Commissioner may license the vehicle as stated in the application for a period not exceeding the unexpired period of the surrendered vehicle licence, upon payment of a licence fee calculated by the Commissioner by multiplying 1/365 of the appropriate licence fee prescribed in Schedule 2 by the number of days in the unexpired period of the surrendered vehicle licence. (L.N. 172 of 1989)

Subject to subregulations (3), (5) and (6), the Commissioner may license a motor vehicle for the period stated in an application under subregulation (1) in respect of the vehicle, and the licence takes effect from the date of issue of the relevant licensing notice. (L.N. 140 of 2024)

On receipt of an application under subregulation (1)(a) in respect of a motor vehicle which is licensed and the licence fee under subregulation (1)(b), the Commissioner may, within the 4 months immediately before the expiry of the vehicle licence (existing vehicle licence), license the vehicle for the further period stated in the application, and the licence takes effect immediately after the expiry of the existing vehicle licence. (L.N. 140 of 2024)

subsection.leadIn: If, after the expiry of a vehicle licence of a motor vehicle, the Commissioner receives an application under subregulation (1), the Commissioner may license the vehicle for the further period stated in the application, and the licence takes effect from the date specified in the relevant licensing notice, which date must not be earlier than the following date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an application sent by post—the date of the relevant post mark;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for any other case—the date on which the Commissioner receives the application. (L.N. 140 of 2024)

content.leadIn: Where the Commissioner licenses a motor vehicle pursuant to subregulation (6), the licence fee payable to the Commissioner for the licence shall be the licence fee under subregulation (1)(b) and an additional fee of 0.33% of the appropriate annual licence fee for each day of the unlicensed period since the previous licence expired:
content.proviso: Provided that the additional fee shall not be payable if the Commissioner is satisfied that the motor vehicle has not been used on a road during the period when it was not licensed. (L.N. 172 of 1989; L.N. 140 of 2024)

subsection.leadIn: On licensing a motor vehicle under these regulations, the Commissioner must issue to the registered owner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a written notice of the licensed period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subregulation (8A), a vehicle licence that is valid during the licensed period, in a form and containing the particulars specified by the Commissioner, for display on the vehicle in accordance with regulation 25. (L.N. 140 of 2024)

subsection.name: 8A
subsection.leadIn: If the latest displayable vehicle licence of a motor vehicle is issued on or after 30 December 2024, on licensing the vehicle under subregulation (5) or (6) and issuing a licensing notice for the licensing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner is not obliged to actually issue another displayable vehicle licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the Commissioner does not issue another displayable vehicle licence—

subparagraph.content: the Commissioner is deemed to have issued, on the date of issue of the licensing notice, a vehicle licence for licensing the vehicle for the further period (renewed vehicle licence); and
the latest displayable vehicle licence is deemed to be the renewed vehicle licence. (L.N. 140 of 2024)

subsection.name: 8B
subsection.content: To avoid doubt, a displayable vehicle licence may be deemed one or more times under subregulation (8A)(b) to be a renewed vehicle licence of the relevant motor vehicle, and each of such deeming does not affect the date of issue and effect of the displayable vehicle licence and each previous deemed renewed vehicle licence. (L.N. 140 of 2024)

subsection.leadIn: In the case of a disabled person who wishes to have licensed a private car of which he is the registered owner and in respect of which, under regulation 9 of the Road Traffic (Driving Licences) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. B), he has proved his fitness to drive—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no licence fee shall be payable where the cylinder capacity of the engine of the private car does not exceed 1 500 cubic centimetres; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the cylinder capacity of the engine of the private car exceeds 1 500 cubic centimetres—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the annual licence fee for the purposes of this regulation shall be calculated by the deduction from the appropriate annual licence fee prescribed in Schedule 2 of the annual licence fee payable in respect of a private car of which the cylinder capacity of the engine does not exceed 1 500 cubic centimetres; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the fee for a licence for 4 months shall be 35% of the annual licence fee calculated in accordance with subparagraph (i) plus an additional fee of $15.

subsection.name: 9A
subsection.content: In the case of a disabled person who wishes to have licensed a motor cycle or a motor tricycle of which he is the registered owner and in respect of which, under regulation 9 of the Road Traffic (Driving Licences) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. B), he has proved his fitness to drive, no licence fee shall be payable. (34 of 1993 s. 14)
The Commissioner may license a motor vehicle subject to such conditions as the Commissioner thinks fit. (L.N. 140 of 2024)

subsection.leadIn: If, because of circumstances beyond the Commissioner’s control, the Commissioner is unable for the time being to issue a licensing notice or vehicle licence, the receipt issued by the Commissioner for the payment of the appropriate licence fee is deemed to be a valid vehicle licence in place of the vehicle licence to be issued—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: from—

subparagraph.content: in the case of subregulation (5)—immediately after the expiry of the existing vehicle licence; or
in any other case—the date of issue of the receipt; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: until the time when the following happens, whichever is the earlier—

subparagraph.content: the issue of the licensing notice or vehicle licence;
the expiry of a period of 30 days after the date of issue of the receipt. (L.N. 140 of 2024)

subsection.leadIn: Despite the amendments of these regulations by the 2024 Amendment Regulation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a motor vehicle, a vehicle licence (within the meaning of these regulations as in force immediately before 30 December 2024) that was issued before 30 December 2024 is taken to be a vehicle licence within the meaning of these regulations as amended by the 2024 Amendment Regulation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date of issue and effect of such a vehicle licence are not affected. (L.N. 140 of 2024)

subsection.leadIn: Where the vehicle licence of a motor vehicle (original vehicle licence) is not in the current specified form, if the Commissioner decides to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue a duplicate vehicle licence for the original vehicle licence under regulation 59(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue an updated vehicle licence for updating the particulars in the original vehicle licence,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner may issue the duplicate vehicle licence or updated vehicle licence in the current specified form. (L.N. 140 of 2024)

subsection.content: For the purposes of subregulation (14), a vehicle licence is issued in the current specified form if the vehicle licence is issued in the form currently specified under subregulation (8)(b) and contains the particulars currently specified under subregulation (8)(b). (L.N. 140 of 2024)

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—
subsection.def: 2024 Amendment Regulation (《2024年修訂規例》) means the Road Traffic (Registration and Licensing of Vehicles) (Amendment) Regulation 2024 (L.N. 140 of 2024); (E.R. 1 of 2025)

def.name: DisplayableVehicleLicence
def.leadIn: displayable vehicle licence (供展示用車輛牌照), in relation to a motor vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means a vehicle licence actually issued under subregulation (8)(b) for display on the vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: includes—

subparagraph.content: a duplicate vehicle licence issued under regulation 59(1); and
a vehicle licence issued for updating the particulars in a vehicle licence. (L.N. 140 of 2024)

section.name: s22
section.heading: Vehicle licence and certificate of allocation to remain property of the Government

subsection.content: A vehicle licence issued to a registered owner shall remain the property of the Government and the Commissioner may require a vehicle licence to be returned to him at any time.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: A certificate of allocation shall remain the property of the Government and the Commissioner may require a certificate of allocation to be returned to him at any time. (25 of 2005 s. 18)

Any police officer or other officer authorized by the Commissioner shall have power to seize a vehicle licence that is cancelled, and for that purpose to detach it from a motor vehicle, and to seize a certificate of allocation that is cancelled. (25 of 2005 s. 18)

section.name: s23
section.heading: Licensing of motor vehicles for use in Lantau only

subsection.content: Subject to subregulation (1A), a motor vehicle may be used on a road in Lantau only, if the vehicle is licensed under this regulation. (L.N. 172 of 1997)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Where a motor vehicle is licensed under this regulation and regulation 26, subregulation (1) shall be construed as permitting the motor vehicle to be used on a road in Lantau or Chek Lap Kok. (L.N. 172 of 1997)

subsection.leadIn: Any person who wishes to have licensed for use only in Lantau a motor vehicle of which he is the registered owner may deliver to the Commissioner an application for such licence in a form specified by the Commissioner and shall pay to the Commissioner one quarter of the appropriate licence fee prescribed in Schedule 2:

proviso.name: proviso
proviso.leadIn: Provided that regulation 21(9) shall apply to an applicant who is a disabled person for the purposes of that regulation and the licence fee payable under this subregulation shall be— (E.R. 3 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a licence for 12 months, one quarter of the licence fee payable under regulation 21(9)(b)(i); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a licence for 4 months, 35% of the licence fee payable under paragraph (a) plus an additional fee of $15.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may license a motor vehicle for use in Lantau only, and where he does so, he shall cause the vehicle licence to be endorsed with the words “PERMITTED TO BE USED ONLY ON LANTAU” and the characters “祇准在大嶼山使用” in such manner as he shall think fit and shall cause such endorsement to be made on the registration document relating to the vehicle if he thinks fit.

Subject to this regulation, regulation 21 shall apply in respect of the documents which are required to be submitted with an application for a licence and the licensing of motor vehicles for use in Lantau.

subsection.def: For the purposes of this regulation, road (道路) does not include a private road. (L.N. 21 of 1989)

subsection.content: A licence issued under this regulation and having effect immediately before the commencement* of the Road Traffic (Registration and Licensing of Vehicles) (Amendment) Regulation 1997 (L.N. 172 of 1997) (the Amendment Regulation) shall be taken as a licence issued in accordance with the Regulation as amended by the Amendment Regulation. (L.N. 172 of 1997)

section.name: s23A
section.heading: Licensing of motor vehicles for use on private roads in Lantau only

subsection.content: A motor vehicle may be used on a private road in Lantau only, if the vehicle is licensed under regulation 23 or this regulation.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who wishes to have licensed for use only on private roads in Lantau a motor vehicle of which he is the registered owner may deliver to the Commissioner an application for such licence in a form specified by the Commissioner and shall pay to the Commissioner one-tenth of the appropriate licence fee prescribed in Schedule 2:

proviso.name: proviso
proviso.leadIn: Provided that regulation 21(9) shall apply to an applicant who is a disabled person for the purpose of that regulation and the licence fee payable under this subregulation shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a licence for 12 months, one-tenth of the licence fee payable under regulation 21(9)(b)(i); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a licence for 4 months, 35% of the licence fee payable under paragraph (a) plus an additional fee of $15.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may license a motor vehicle for use on private roads in Lantau only, and where he does so, he shall cause the vehicle licence to be endorsed with the words “PERMITTED TO BE USED ONLY ON PRIVATE ROADS ON LANTAU” and the characters “只准在大嶼山的私家路上行駛” in such manner as he shall think fit and shall cause such endorsement to be made on the registration document relating to the vehicle if he thinks fit.

Subject to this regulation, regulation 21 shall apply in respect of the documents which are required to be submitted with an application for a licence and the licensing of motor vehicles for use on private roads in Lantau.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Refund of fee on surrender of vehicle licence

subsection.content: The Commissioner, on the surrender to him of a valid vehicle licence, may make a refund of a portion of the licence fee paid for the licensing of the motor vehicle relating to the unexpired period of the surrendered vehicle licence in accordance with the table in Schedule 6.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any motor vehicle is broken up, stolen, destroyed or despatched permanently out of Hong Kong and the vehicle licence issued in respect of the vehicle is thereby lost or destroyed; and (L.N. 172 of 1989)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the registered owner of the motor vehicle has, within 15 days after the vehicle is broken up, stolen, destroyed or despatched out of Hong Kong— (L.N. 172 of 1989)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: notified the Commissioner thereof; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: delivered to the Commissioner the registration document relating to the vehicle,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner may make a refund of a portion of the licence fee paid for the licensing of the vehicle relating to the unexpired period of the vehicle licence in accordance with the table in Schedule 6.

subsection.leadIn: Except as otherwise provided by the Ordinance, a motor vehicle must not be on or be used on any road unless a valid vehicle licence in respect of the vehicle is displayed— (L.N. 219 of 1987; L.N. 140 of 2024)

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: in the case of a motor cycle, in a conspicuous place on the left-hand side of the vehicle in such a manner that it is clearly visible from that side of the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subregulation (1), if a receipt is deemed to be a valid vehicle licence pursuant to regulation 21(11) or 59(6), the receipt, or (for a receipt in the form of an electronic record) a clearly legible printout of the receipt that conforms to the specifications specified by the Commissioner in the receipt, must be displayed— (L.N. 140 of 2024)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the appropriate place and manner specified in subregulation (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in such form and manner as the Commissioner may specify in the receipt. (L.N. 140 of 2024)

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may license taxis—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on application, whether or not following a determination by lot pursuant to section 23(5) of the Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if he considers it expedient, by calling for tenders on the payment of a premium; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in such other manner as the Chief Executive in Council thinks fit. (3 of 2002 s. 15)

subsection.content: On the licensing of a motor vehicle as a taxi the Commissioner shall specify on the vehicle licence issued to registered owner under regulation 21(8), in English and in Chinese characters, the area within which the taxi is licensed to be available for hire or to carry passengers.

Subject to subregulation (2), where the Commissioner calls for tenders under regulation 26(1)(b), the Commissioner may license the number of taxis allocated pursuant to such tender only to a person whose tender the Commissioner has accepted.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Any person whose tender has been accepted and who fails to pay the premium within 14 days after receipt of notification of acceptance of his tender shall forfeit the right to license the number of taxis allocated to him and to any deposit paid by him.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Any person who fails to license the number of taxis allocated to him within 6 months after the notification of acceptance of his tender shall forfeit the right to license the number of taxis not then licensed and the deposit paid by him in respect of any taxi for which the right to license is forfeited.

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Any person who transfers or purports to transfer his right to license any number of taxis allocated to him shall forfeit the right to license the number of taxis so allocated and the deposit paid by him in respect of any taxi for which the right to license is forfeited.

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Any premium payable under regulation 26(1)(b) shall be in addition to the registration and licence fees prescribed in Schedule 2 and shall not be refundable in any circumstances.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Forfeiture of right to license taxis

subsection.content: Any person who fails to license the number of taxis allocated to him within the time specified in the notification of the allocation to him of the taxis following a determination by lot pursuant to section 23(5) of the Ordinance shall forfeit the right to license the number of taxis not then licensed.
Any person who transfers or purports to transfer his right to license any number of taxis allocated to him shall forfeit the right to license the number of taxis so allocated.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Area limitations for New Territories and Lantau taxis

subsection.content: No person as registered owner or as driver shall cause or permit a taxi that is licensed to be available for hire or to carry passengers within the New Territories or Lantau to stand or to ply for hire or to be available for hire or to carry passengers in any area or place other than the permitted area.

No person as registered owner or as driver shall use or cause or permit to be used a taxi that is licensed to be available for hire or to carry passengers within the New Territories or Lantau for the carriage of any passenger from any place outside the permitted area to any other place whether in that area or in another area.

Nothing in this regulation shall prevent a taxi that is licensed to be available for hire or to carry passengers within the New Territories or Lantau from travelling to or from any place outside the permitted area if it is for the sole purpose of attending a vehicle examination centre for an examination arranged by prior appointment.

Where a taxi that is licensed to be available for hire or to carry passengers within the New Territories or Lantau is travelling to or from a vehicle examination centre pursuant to subregulation (3), no passengers may be carried for hire or reward.

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: The Commissioner may cause or, by permit in writing, permit to be erected or placed on or near any road leading from inside the permitted area for New Territories taxis to any place outside that permitted area a traffic sign of the type shown in Figure No. 1 in Schedule 11 and the meaning of that sign shall be in accordance with its content and the note relating to the Figure of that sign in the Schedule. (L.N. 262 of 1984)

subsection.name: 4AA
subsection.content: The Commissioner may cause or, by permit in writing, permit to be erected or placed on or near any road leading from inside the permitted area for Lantau taxis to any place outside that permitted area a traffic sign of the type shown in Figure No. 2 in Schedule 11 and the meaning of that sign shall be in accordance with its content and the note relating to the Figure of that sign in the Schedule. (L.N. 172 of 1997)

subsection.name: 4B
subsection.content: The Commissioner may by notice in the Gazette amend the names of the roads specified in Schedule 7 upon the names of the roads having been changed. (L.N. 101 of 1992)

subsection.def: In this regulation permitted area (許可地區) means the area specified in Schedule 7.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Application for and issue of international circulation permits

subsection.content: Any visitor who brings a motor vehicle into Hong Kong from a place outside Hong Kong and who desires to obtain an international circulation permit in respect of the vehicle, may deliver to the Commissioner an application, in a form specified by the Commissioner, for the permit. (L.N. 170 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: If an applicant for an international circulation permit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: satisfies the Commissioner that the applicant is resident outside Hong Kong and that the motor vehicle is only temporarily in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: produces to the Commissioner documentary proof of a policy of insurance that is valid in respect of the vehicle on the date the permit takes effect; and (L.N. 170 of 2025)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: satisfies the Commissioner that it is not intended during the currency of the permit to use the vehicle in Hong Kong for the carriage of passengers or goods for hire or reward or, in the case of a goods vehicle, in connection with a trade or business, (L.N. 170 of 2025)

subsection.continued: the Commissioner may issue to the applicant free of charge an international circulation permit in respect of the vehicle in Form 4 of Schedule 8. (L.N. 170 of 2025)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If the Commissioner is not satisfied with the copy of any document produced under subregulation (2)(b), the Commissioner may require the applicant to produce the original of the document. (L.N. 170 of 2025)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: An international circulation permit may be issued either in paper form or in the form of an electronic record. (L.N. 170 of 2025)

subsection.name: 2C
subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may, subject to subregulation (5), specify the validity period of an international circulation permit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may impose on an international circulation permit any condition that the Commissioner considers appropriate. (L.N. 170 of 2025)

subsection.content: Section 52(1) of the Ordinance shall not apply to a vehicle in respect of which an international circulation permit is in force.

subsection.leadIn: The following particulars shall be supplied in an application under subregulation (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the full name, home address and identity document number of the person to whom the international circulation permit is to be granted; (20 of 2021 s. 87)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date and place of entry into Hong Kong of the motor vehicle in question;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the make and chassis number of the motor vehicle and such other particulars describing the vehicle as the Commissioner may direct;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the letters and numbers on the registration plates, if any, of the motor vehicle and, if different, of any trailer drawn thereby, together with the country or place of registration; (3 of 2002 s. 15)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in any case where the motor vehicle is drawing a trailer, the name and manufacture of the trailer and its serial or other identification number; (20 of 2021 s. 87)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the address in Hong Kong of the person to whom the international circulation permit is to be granted or, if none, the name and address in Hong Kong of some other person through whom he may be contacted while in Hong Kong; and (20 of 2021 s. 87)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the e-contact means of the person to whom the international circulation permit is to be granted while the person is in Hong Kong. (20 of 2021 s. 87)

subsection.content: An international circulation permit shall not be granted for any period exceeding 12 months from the date on which the motor vehicle was last brought into Hong Kong.

section.name: s31A
section.heading: Changes of particulars of international circulation permit holder

subsection.content: Within 72 hours after any change of name, address, e-contact means or identity document of a holder of an international circulation permit previously provided by the holder to the Commissioner, the holder shall notify the Commissioner in writing of such change. (20 of 2021 s. 88)

The Commissioner may require a person who has given a notification under subregulation (1) to provide such information or to produce such document as the Commissioner may reasonably require as proof of the change within 14 days from the day on which the requirement is made, and the person shall comply with such requirement.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner must assign to a motor vehicle in respect of which the Commissioner has issued an international circulation permit— (L.N. 170 of 2025)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a vehicle in respect of which a visitor’s registration document is produced— (25 of 2005 s. 19)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a registration mark that is identical to the registration number recorded in that document; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the registration number recorded in that document is identical to a registration mark which has been assigned or allocated under these regulations (by a comparison only of the sequence of arrangement of the letters and numerals), a registration mark consisting of 2 letters as its prefix, followed by a number of not more than 4 digits (not being a number listed in Schedule 5); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of any other vehicle— (L.N. 170 of 2025)

subparagraph.content: a registration mark consisting only of a number of not more than 8 digits (not being a number listed in Schedule 5); or
a registration mark consisting of any combination of letters and numerals the total of which does not exceed 8. (L.N. 170 of 2025)

content.leadIn: During the currency of an international circulation permit, regulation 8 shall apply to the motor vehicle to which the permit relates as if the reference therein to the registered owner was a reference to the holder of an international circulation permit and references to the registration mark were references to the registration mark assigned to the motor vehicle under subregulation (1):

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: regulation 8 shall not apply to a registration mark assigned under subregulation (1)(a)(i) if the corresponding requirements of the law under which, or authority by whom, the registration mark is issued are complied with, and if any letters in the registration mark are in Roman characters and any numbers therein are in ordinary European numerals; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a registration mark assigned under subregulation (1)(a)(i) need not be displayed on the front of the vehicle if that is not required by the law under which or the authority by whom the registration mark is issued.

subsection.content: The holder of an international circulation permit shall, during the currency of the permit issued in respect of a motor vehicle to which a registration mark is assigned under subregulation (1)(a)(i), display at the back of the vehicle so as to be clearly distinguishable a nationality sign indicating the country or place in which the vehicle is registered. (3 of 2002 s. 15)

During the currency of an international circulation permit issued in respect of a motor vehicle in respect of which a visitor’s registration document was produced and to which a registration mark is assigned under subregulation (1)(a)(i), regulation 7(3) shall apply in respect of a visitor’s registration document as it applies to a registration document.

This regulation shall apply to a trailer drawn by a motor vehicle to which an international circulation permit relates, during the currency of the permit, as if references to the registration mark were references to the registration mark assigned to the motor vehicle under this regulation.

Where the Commissioner assigns a registration mark to a motor vehicle under regulation 34(1)(a)(ii) or (b), the Commissioner shall issue with the international circulation permit a registration card free of charge in such form and containing such particulars as the Commissioner thinks fit. (25 of 2005 s. 20)
A registration card may be issued either in paper form or in the form of an electronic record. (L.N. 170 of 2025)
A police officer or the Commissioner may request the holder of a registration card to produce the card for inspection. (L.N. 170 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: A person to whom a request is made under subregulation (3) must, within 72 hours after the request and at the place specified by the police officer or the Commissioner at the time of the request, produce for inspection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the registration card is a paper registration card—the paper registration card; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the registration card is an e-registration card—a clearly legible printout of the e-registration card that conforms to the specifications specified by the Commissioner in the conditions of the international circulation permit. (L.N. 170 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: A motor vehicle in respect of which an international circulation permit is in force must not be on or be used on any road unless the document mentioned in subregulation (2) is displayed—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: in any other case—

subparagraph.content: for a motor vehicle with a fixed windscreen—on the left-hand side of the vehicle’s windscreen in a manner that it is clearly visible from the front of the vehicle; or
for a motor vehicle without a fixed windscreen—in a conspicuous place on the left-hand side of the vehicle in a manner that it is clearly visible from the front of the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: The document is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the international circulation permit is a paper ICP—the paper ICP; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the international circulation permit is an e-ICP—a clearly legible printout of the e-ICP that conforms to the specifications specified by the Commissioner in the conditions of the permit.

section.name: s35B
section.heading: International circulation permits cease to be valid in certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if any of the following events occurs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a motor vehicle in respect of which an international circulation permit is in force—

subparagraph.content: is sold, transferred or destroyed; or
is registered under Part II;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the holder of an international circulation permit gives up the permit by written notice to the Commissioner.

subsection.content: On the occurrence of the event, the international circulation permit ceases to be valid.

subsection.leadIn: The holder of the international circulation permit must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the permit is a paper ICP—

subparagraph.content: ensure that the paper ICP is not displayed on the motor vehicle; and
within 72 hours after the event occurs, return the paper ICP to the Commissioner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the permit is an e-ICP—ensure that no printout of the e-ICP is displayed on the motor vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: If the event is one mentioned in subregulation (1)(a), the holder of the international circulation permit must also, within 72 hours after the event occurs, notify the Commissioner in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the occurrence of the event; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the motor vehicle is sold or transferred—the name of the new owner of the vehicle and the new owner’s address, if any, in Hong Kong.

section.name: s35C
section.heading: Cancellation of international circulation permits by Commissioner

subsection.content: If a condition of an international circulation permit is contravened, the Commissioner may, by written notice to the holder of the permit, cancel the permit.

subsection.leadIn: If an international circulation permit issued in respect of a motor vehicle is cancelled under subregulation (1), the holder of the permit must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the permit is a paper ICP—

subparagraph.content: ensure that the paper ICP is not displayed on the vehicle; and
within the period specified in the notice under subregulation (1), return the paper ICP to the Commissioner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the permit is an e-ICP—ensure that no printout of the e-ICP is displayed on the vehicle.

section.name: s35D
section.heading: Power of seizure
section.leadIn: If regulation 35B(3) or 35C(2) is contravened in relation to an international circulation permit issued in respect of a motor vehicle, a police officer or any other officer authorized by the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: may—

subparagraph.content: if the permit is a paper ICP—seize the paper ICP; or
if the permit is an e-ICP—seize a printout of the e-ICP that is displayed on the vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, for the purpose of the seizure, detach the paper ICP or printout from the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: Where any vehicle in respect of which an international circulation permit is issued—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: remains in Hong Kong after the permit has expired; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is transferred to another owner in Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: the vehicle shall be registered and licensed under these regulations with effect from the date the vehicle was first brought into Hong Kong.

subsection.content: No person shall drive or use or suffer or permit to be driven or used any vehicle to which subregulation (1) applies unless the vehicle is registered and licensed in accordance with that subregulation.

Subject to subregulations (2), (2A), (2B) and (3), the provisions of Part II shall apply to a trailer as if references therein to a motor vehicle and registered owner were references to a trailer and registered owner of a trailer respectively and references therein to a registration mark were references to the registration mark assigned to the trailer as referred to in subregulation (2). (L.N. 262 of 1984; L.N. 240 of 1985; 25 of 2005 s. 21)
The registration mark assigned to a trailer pursuant to regulation 6(1)(a) shall consist of the letter “T”, as the suffix, preceded by a number. (25 of 2005 s. 21)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: On registering a trailer, the Commissioner shall assign to the trailer a permitted gross vehicle weight which shall be such weight as he shall determine after considering—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particulars contained in the application for registration submitted in respect of the trailer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any information available from the manufacturer of the trailer; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any regulations made under the Ordinance. (L.N. 240 of 1985)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: The assignment by the Commissioner of a permitted gross vehicle weight to any trailer on registration of the trailer on or after 25 August 1984, and prior to the commencement* of the Road Traffic (Registration and Licensing of Vehicles) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 1985 (L.N. 240 of 1985), is hereby declared to be valid and shall be deemed to have been validly assigned under subregulation (2A). (L.N. 240 of 1985)
Regulation 17(2)(b)(ii) shall not apply in the case of the transfer of ownership of a trailer. (L.N. 262 of 1984)

subsection.leadIn: Any person who wishes to have licensed a trailer of which he is the registered owner shall deliver to the Commissioner an application therefor in a form specified by the Commissioner and shall, subject to subregulation (2), pay to the Commissioner the following licence fee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a licence for 12 months, the appropriate licence fee prescribed in Schedule 2; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a licence for 4 months, an amount equal to 35% of the appropriate licence fee prescribed in Schedule 2.

subsection.content: Where a trailer is to be licensed for use only in Lantau, the applicant shall pay one quarter of the appropriate licence fee prescribed in Schedule 2.

On receipt of an application and the licence fee under regulation 38 in respect of a trailer, the Commissioner may license the trailer for the period stated in the application, and the licence takes effect from the date of issue of the relevant licensing notice. (L.N. 172 of 1989; L.N. 140 of 2024)

Subject to subregulation (1) and regulation 38, Part III (except regulation 21(1A)(c), (3), (9) and (9A)) applies to the licensing of a trailer as if the trailer were a motor vehicle. (L.N. 140 of 2024)

subsection.leadIn: Any owner of a rickshaw who wishes to have the rickshaw licensed shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: deliver to the Commissioner an application therefor in a form specified by the Commissioner which shall be accompanied by his identity document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: pay to the Commissioner the following licence fee—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for a licence for 12 months, the appropriate licence fee prescribed in Schedule 2; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for a licence for 4 months, an amount equal to 35% of the appropriate licence fee prescribed in Schedule 2.

subsection.content: An application under subregulation (1) shall be signed by the owner of the rickshaw or by some person duly authorized by him in writing.
Before a rickshaw is licensed, the Commissioner may require the owner thereof to produce the rickshaw for examination at any place specified in such requirement.

On receipt of an application and the licence fee under subregulation (1) at any time during the period of 4 months immediately preceding the date of expiry of the vehicle licence, the Commissioner may license the rickshaw for such period, not exceeding 12 months, as is stated in the application and such licence shall take effect from the date of expiry of the existing vehicle licence. (L.N. 172 of 1989)

On the licensing of a rickshaw the Commissioner shall issue to the owner of the rickshaw, for display on the rickshaw in accordance with regulation 41(1), a vehicle licence in a form and containing such particulars specified by the Commissioner and a number consisting of not more than 3 digits.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Display of vehicle licence and licence number

subsection.leadIn: The owner of a licensed rickshaw to whom a vehicle licence is issued under regulation 40(5) shall display—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vehicle licence in a conspicuous place on the front of the rickshaw in respect of which the licence is issued, in such a manner that it is clearly visible from in front of the rickshaw; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the vehicle licence number in a conspicuous place on the back of the rickshaw in such a manner that it is clearly visible from behind the rickshaw.

subsection.content: No person shall drive or use or suffer or permit to be driven or used any rickshaw on which a vehicle licence and vehicle licence number is not displayed in accordance with subregulation (1).

If any person being a manufacturer or repairer of or dealer in vehicles wishes to obtain a trade licence in respect of any vehicle used by him he shall deliver to the Commissioner an application for a trade licence in a form specified by the Commissioner and shall deposit with the Commissioner the sum of $1,000 and, if the trade licence is for a period of one year, pay to the Commissioner the trade licence fee prescribed in Schedule 2.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: An application under subregulation (1) must state the applicant’s name, address, e-contact means and identity document number. (20 of 2021 s. 89)

Where a trade licence is for a period less than one year, the applicant shall pay to the Commissioner the licence fee calculated by the Commissioner by multiplying one-tenth of the trade licence fee prescribed in Schedule 2 by the number of months for which the licence is applied for, any part of a month counting as a month.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner, on being satisfied that the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a bona fide manufacturer or repairer of or dealer in non-left-hand drive vehicles; and (L.N. 88 of 2012)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has an adequate policy of insurance in respect of such vehicles,

subsection.continued: shall issue to the applicant a trade licence in accordance with the application together with a set of 2 trade plates with a weather-proof holder for the trade licence attached to one trade plate.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner, on being satisfied that the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a bona fide manufacturer or repairer of or dealer in left-hand drive vehicles for re-export to a place outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has an adequate policy of insurance in respect of those vehicles,

subsection.continued: may issue to the applicant a trade licence in accordance with the application together with a set of 2 trade plates with a weather-proof holder for the trade licence attached to one of them. (L.N. 88 of 2012)

subsection.content: Regulation 24 shall apply, mutatis mutandis, to trade licences to the same extent as that regulation applies to vehicle licences.

section.name: s43A
section.heading: Changes of particulars of trade licence holder
section.leadIn: Within 72 hours after any change of name, address, e-contact means or identity document number of a holder of a trade licence, the holder must send to the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a written notice of the change; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a change of name or address, the trade licence.

subsection.leadIn: Each trade licence shall contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the person to whom the trade licence is issued;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of the trade plate issued in respect of such trade licence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the validity period of the trade licence which shall not exceed one year; and (L.N. 52 of 2007)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the serial number of the trade licence.

subsection.content: If a trade plate is issued under regulation 43(1), it must display the letter “T”, followed by the number allocated in respect thereof, in red on a white background in a form specified by the Commissioner. (25 of 2005 s. 22; L.N. 88 of 2012)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If a trade plate is issued under regulation 43(1A), it must display the letter “T”, followed by the number allocated in respect of the plate, in blue on a white background in a form specified by the Commissioner. (L.N. 88 of 2012)
Trade plates issued in respect of a trade licence shall remain the property of the Commissioner and shall not be altered in any way after issue, except by the Commissioner.

When a trade licence is cancelled or expires without being replaced by a new trade licence bearing the same number, the person to whom the set of trade plates relating to the licence were issued shall return the set forthwith to the Commissioner. (L.N. 88 of 2012)

Upon return of the set of trade plates to him under subregulation (4), the Commissioner shall repay the deposit made in respect thereof less such amount as the Commissioner shall consider necessary to make good any damage to such trade plates.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Display of trade plates and licence

subsection.leadIn: When a vehicle other than a motor cycle or trailer is being used under a trade licence, the holder of the trade licence must display or cause the driver or the authorized user to display—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a trade plate issued to the holder with the trade licence attached to it on the foremost part of the vehicle in a vertical position, so that every letter and numeral of the trade plate is vertical and is distinguishable from the front of the vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the other trade plate issued in respect of the trade licence on the rearmost part of the vehicle in a vertical position, so that every letter and numeral of the trade plate is vertical and is distinguishable from the rear of the vehicle.

subsection.content: When a motor cycle or trailer is being used under a trade licence, the holder of the trade licence must display or cause the driver or the authorized user to display a trade plate issued to the holder with the trade licence attached to it on the rearmost part of the motor cycle or trailer in a vertical position, so that every letter and numeral of the trade plate is vertical and is distinguishable from the rear of the motor cycle or trailer.

When a vehicle other than a motor cycle or trailer is being used under a trade licence by an authorized user or by a prospective purchaser for the purpose of test or trial, the authorized user or prospective purchaser must display the trade plates in accordance with the requirements of subregulation (1)(a) and (b).

When a motor cycle or trailer is being used under a trade licence by an authorized user or by a prospective purchaser for the purpose of test or trial, the authorized user or prospective purchaser must display the trade plates in accordance with the requirements of subregulation (2).

section.name: s46
section.heading: Trade licence not transferable
section.content: A trade licence shall not be used by any person other than the holder of the trade licence and the holder of a trade licence shall not allow or suffer the trade licence or the trade plates issued to him to be used by any other person but this regulation shall not be contravened if the holder of a trade licence or an authorized user is present and in charge of the vehicle or if the vehicle is a non-left-hand drive vehicle, it is constructed for use by one person only and is being used by a prospective purchaser for the purpose of test or trial.

section.name: s46A
section.heading: Authorization to use trade licence and record of authorization

subsection.content: The holder of a trade licence may, either generally or in a particular case, authorize in writing an employee of the holder who engages in the holder’s business as a manufacturer or repairer of or dealer in vehicles to use the trade licence.

subsection.leadIn: The holder of a trade licence must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sign the authorization given under subregulation (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the holder is a company, ensure that the authorization is signed by a person authorized for the purpose and impressed with the seal or chop of the company.

subsection.leadIn: The holder of a trade licence must also ensure that the authorization—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: bears a serial number; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contains the particulars specified in Schedule 12.

subsection.content: If an authorized user is not a person designated under subregulation (5), the authorized user must obtain the approval of such a person or the holder of the trade licence before using the trade licence.
The holder of a trade licence may designate a person to give the approval for the purposes of subregulation (4).

The holder of a trade licence must not designate a person under subregulation (5) unless the person is in charge of or responsible for managing the holder’s business as a manufacturer or repairer of or dealer in vehicles.

If the holder of a trade licence authorizes an authorized user to use the trade licence under subregulation (1), the holder must maintain a record of the authorization containing the particulars specified in Schedule 13.
The holder of a trade licence must immediately produce the record of the authorization for inspection on request by any police officer or the Commissioner.

subsection.leadIn: While driving a vehicle in use under a trade licence or being present and in charge of a non-left-hand drive vehicle in use under a trade licence by a prospective purchaser for the purpose of test or trial, an authorized user must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carry on board the vehicle the written authorization mentioned in subregulation (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately produce that written authorization for inspection on request by any police officer or the Commissioner.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Limitations of use of trade licence

subsection.content: A trade licence must not be used in respect of any vehicle other than a vehicle that is in the possession of the holder of the trade licence in the course of the holder’s business as a manufacturer or repairer of or dealer in vehicles.

A trade licence must not at any time be used in respect of a vehicle that is being used for the conveyance of passengers for hire or reward or in respect of a vehicle that is being used for the conveyance of goods in the course of trade or for the delivery or removal of goods.

Unless used pursuant to a movement permit issued under regulation 53, a non-left-hand drive vehicle must not be used under a trade licence issued under regulation 43(1) if an application for registration and licensing of the vehicle under these regulations would be unsuccessful by virtue of failure to comply with the Road Traffic (Construction and Maintenance of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. A) or for any other reason.

subsection.leadIn: A left-hand drive vehicle must not be used under a trade licence issued under regulation 43(1A) unless the vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was imported into Hong Kong not more than 12 months ago;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is intended for re-export to a place outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: complies with paragraphs 1, 2 and 3 of Article 22 of the 1949 Convention.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subregulations (1) and (2) and regulation 46, a trade licence issued under regulation 43(1) may be used only for driving—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an unregistered non-left-hand drive vehicle in the course of delivery to a motor dealer or exhibitor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a non-left-hand drive vehicle for the purpose of presale demonstration to a potential customer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a non-left-hand drive vehicle for the purpose of mechanical test; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a non-left-hand drive vehicle for the purpose of examining, repairing or presale retrofitting the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subregulations (1) and (2) and regulation 46, a trade licence issued under regulation 43(1A) may be used only for driving—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an unregistered left-hand drive vehicle in the course of delivery to a motor dealer or exhibitor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a left-hand drive vehicle for the purpose of examining, repairing or presale retrofitting the vehicle; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an unregistered left-hand drive vehicle to a port or boundary control point for the purpose of re-export to a place outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: A vehicle must not be used under a trade licence for any purpose other than a purpose for which the vehicle is authorized by these regulations to be used under the licence.

When a non-left-hand drive vehicle is being used under a trade licence, the number of passengers carried in or on the vehicle must not exceed 2, except where the Commissioner has given permission in writing for the carrying of more than 2 passengers in which case the number of passengers must not exceed the number specified in the permit.

subsection.leadIn: When a left-hand drive vehicle is being used under a trade licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the driver of the vehicle must not be a person other than the holder of the trade licence or an authorized user; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no passenger may be carried in or on the vehicle.

subsection.content: When a left-hand drive vehicle is being used under a trade licence, the driver of the vehicle must, on request by any police officer or the Commissioner, immediately produce evidence that the vehicle was imported into Hong Kong not more than 12 months ago.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Register of journeys under trade licence

subsection.content: The holder of a trade licence must maintain a register of all journeys made by vehicles in use under the trade licence.

subsection.leadIn: The holder of a trade licence must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the register contains the particulars specified in Schedule 14; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless otherwise specified in that Schedule, the particulars are entered clearly and legibly in the register before a journey starts.

subsection.content: A person who enters the particulars in the register must ensure that the particulars are entered clearly and legibly.
The holder of a trade licence must immediately produce the register maintained under subregulation (1) for inspection on request by any police officer or the Commissioner.

subsection.leadIn: While driving a vehicle in use under a trade licence or being present and in charge of a non-left-hand drive vehicle in use under a trade licence by a prospective purchaser for the purpose of test or trial, an authorized user must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: carry on board the vehicle a duplicate copy of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the register; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the register contains the particulars of more than 30 journeys made by vehicles in use under the trade licence, the part of the register that contains the particulars of the latest 30 journeys; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately produce that copy for inspection on request by any police officer or the Commissioner.

subsection.content: If a vehicle is constructed for use by 1 person only and is being used under a trade licence by a prospective purchaser for the purpose of test or trial, the holder of the trade licence must ensure that the duplicate copy of the register or the part of the register specified in subregulation (5)(a) is kept on board the vehicle for inspection by any police officer or the Commissioner.

Any person who wishes to drive a motor vehicle, or wishes a motor vehicle to be driven, on a road closed in accordance with the Road Traffic (Traffic Control) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. G) (hereinafter in this regulation referred to as a closed road) may apply to the Commissioner for a closed road permit and the Commissioner may issue such a permit subject to such conditions and in respect of such period as the Commissioner may think fit.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: A closed road permit may be issued to the holder of a trade licence for use in connection with the trade licence in relation to any vehicle that is in the possession of the holder in the course of the holder’s business as a manufacturer or repairer of or dealer in vehicles. (L.N. 88 of 2012)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: Without affecting subregulation (1), a closed road permit issued under subregulation (1A) is subject to the conditions specified in subregulations (1C) and (1D). (L.N. 88 of 2012)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.leadIn: A closed road permit issued under subregulation (1A) may be used only for driving—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an unregistered non-left-hand drive vehicle in the course of delivery to a motor dealer or exhibitor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an unregistered non-left-hand drive vehicle to or from a place outside Hong Kong for the purpose of repairing or presale retrofitting the vehicle; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an unregistered left-hand drive vehicle to a port or boundary control point for the purpose of re-export to a place outside Hong Kong. (L.N. 88 of 2012)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.content: A motor vehicle in use in connection with a trade licence under a closed road permit issued under subregulation (1A) may only be driven on a closed road within a boundary control point specified in the permit. (L.N. 88 of 2012)
No closed road permit shall be valid for more than 12 months. (L.N. 52 of 2007)

subsection.leadIn: No fee is to be charged for the issue of a closed road permit except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a permit issued under subregulation (1) in respect of a closed road in Lantau;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a permit issued under subregulation (1) to a person who wishes to drive a motor vehicle to which the permit relates out of Hong Kong on a closed road; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a permit issued under subregulation (1A). (L.N. 88 of 2012)

subsection.leadIn: Where a fee is, under subregulation (3), chargeable for a closed road permit it shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an application for a closed road permit valid for 12 months, the appropriate closed road permit fee prescribed in Schedule 2; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an application for a closed road permit valid for less than 12 months, a fee equal to one-twelfth of the fee referred to in paragraph (a) multiplied by the number of months for which the permit is sought, any part of a month counting as one month. (L.N. 96 of 1985)

subsection.content: Every person to whom a closed road permit is issued, and every person who drives a motor vehicle to which such permit relates on a closed road, shall comply with the conditions, if any, of the permit.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Bus lane permits, prohibited zone permits and restricted zone permits

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wishes to drive a motor vehicle, or wishes a motor vehicle to be driven, in a bus lane or prohibited zone within the meaning of the Road Traffic (Traffic Control) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. G); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: wishes to drive or use a motor vehicle, or wishes a motor vehicle to be driven or used, in a restricted zone within the meaning of the Road Traffic (Traffic Control) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. G),

subsection.continued: may apply to the Commissioner for a permit for that purpose (hereinafter referred to as a bus lane permit, prohibited zone permit or restricted zone permit, as the case may be) and the Commissioner may issue such a permit free of charge subject to such conditions and in respect of such period as the Commissioner may think fit.

subsection.content: No bus lane permit, prohibited zone permit or restricted zone permit shall be valid for more than 12 months. (L.N. 52 of 2007)

Every person to whom a bus lane permit, prohibited zone permit or restricted zone permit is issued, and every person who drives or uses a motor vehicle to which such permit relates in a bus lane, prohibited zone or restricted zone, as the case may be, shall comply with the conditions, if any, of the permit.

The registered owner of a motor vehicle which is not permitted to be used or driven on an expressway under regulation 4(1) of the Road Traffic (Expressway) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. Q) may apply to the Commissioner for a permit (expressway permit) which authorizes him to drive his vehicle or cause it to be driven by another person authorized by him on an expressway.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The holder of a trade licence or of a movement permit may also apply to the Commissioner for an expressway permit that authorizes the holder to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: drive on an expressway a relevant motor vehicle specified in the application; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cause the relevant motor vehicle to be driven on an expressway by another person authorized by the holder. (L.N. 88 of 2012)

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, on receipt of the payment of the appropriate fee prescribed in Schedule 2, issue an expressway permit subject to such conditions and for such period as the Commissioner may think fit.
No expressway permit shall be valid for more than 12 months. (L.N. 52 of 2007)
The holder of an expressway permit and any person who drives on an expressway a motor vehicle to which such permit relates shall comply with the conditions, if any, of the permit.

subsection.leadIn: In subregulation (1A)—
subsection.def: relevant motor vehicle (有關汽車) means a motor vehicle described in subregulation (1) that may be used under the trade licence or the movement permit. (L.N. 88 of 2012)

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may issue a goods permit for the carriage, for hire or reward, of goods other than personal effects in a vehicle registered as a—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: public bus;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: private bus;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: public light bus; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: private light bus.

subsection.content: An application for a goods permit shall be in a form specified by the Commissioner and shall be accompanied by the goods permit fee prescribed in Schedule 2.

On receipt of an application under subregulation (2) and the prescribed fee, the Commissioner may issue a goods permit for a period not exceeding 12 months and subject to such conditions as he may impose.

The Commissioner, on receipt of an application in a form specified by him and the excess passengers permit fee prescribed in Schedule 2, may issue an excess passengers permit subject to such terms and conditions as appear to him necessary authorizing the carriage of passengers in or on a goods vehicle in excess of the maximum passenger seating capacity of the class of vehicles as specified in the Third Schedule to the Road Traffic (Construction and Maintenance of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. A). (L.N. 172 of 1989)
Before issuing an excess passengers permit under subregulation (1) the Commissioner may cause the goods vehicle to be examined.

An excess passengers permit issued under subregulation (1) may be issued for a period not exceeding 12 months but shall in any event expire on the date of expiry of the vehicle licence relating to the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: On the application of the owner of a vehicle which is not licensed and which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not normally used on a road and is driven on a road only for the purpose of proceeding from one site to another,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner, on payment to him of the movement permit fee prescribed in Schedule 2, may issue to the owner a movement permit authorizing the vehicle to be used for that purpose. (23 of 2002 s. 94)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: An application under subregulation (1) must state the name, address, e-contact means and identity document number of the owner of the vehicle concerned. (20 of 2021 s. 91)

In any movement permit, the Commissioner may exempt the vehicle to which the permit relates from compliance with such provisions of the Road Traffic (Construction and Maintenance of Vehicles) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. A) as he may consider necessary.

subsection.leadIn: It is a condition of every movement permit that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the vehicle to which the permit relates is to be moved during the time, and on the roads, specified by the Commissioner in the permit; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the vehicle to which the permit relates is to be moved at a speed not exceeding the speed limit specified by the Commissioner in the permit. (L.N. 67 of 2005)

subsection.name: 3AA
subsection.content: The holder of a movement permit to which a vehicle relates and the driver of the vehicle must each ensure that, if the vehicle is being used in any area where boothless tolling applies, the display movement permit plate requirement is complied with in respect of the vehicle. (20 of 2021 s. 91)

subsection.name: 3AAB
subsection.leadIn: The display movement permit plate requirement means that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the vehicle is a motor cycle—a movement permit plate must be displayed on the rearmost part of the motor cycle in a vertical position, so that every letter and numeral of the movement permit plate is vertical and is distinguishable from the rear of the motor cycle; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the vehicle is not a motor cycle—

subparagraph.content: a movement permit plate must be displayed on the foremost part of the vehicle in a vertical position, so that every letter and numeral of the movement permit plate is vertical and is distinguishable from the front of the vehicle; and

a movement permit plate must be displayed on the rearmost part of the vehicle in a vertical position, so that every letter and numeral of the movement permit plate is vertical and is distinguishable from the rear of the vehicle. (20 of 2021 s. 91)

subsection.name: 3AAC
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subregulation (3AAB), a movement permit plate for a movement permit is a plate that— (E.R. 3 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is in a form specified by the Commissioner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: bears the number of the permit; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is made at the cost of the holder of the permit. (20 of 2021 s. 91)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may impose on a movement permit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a condition that when the vehicle to which the permit relates is being moved on a road, no load may be carried on the vehicle other than such equipment, spares or fuel as are normally carried on the vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: such other conditions relating to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the regulation of road traffic;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the use of vehicles; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the use of roads,

paragraph.continued: as the Commissioner considers necessary. (L.N. 67 of 2005; L.N. 112 of 2005)

subsection.content: A movement permit issued under subregulation (1) shall be valid for a period not exceeding 12 months.

subsection.leadIn: If there is any change of name, address, e-contact means or identity document number of the holder of a movement permit issued in respect of a vehicle, the holder must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 72 hours after the change, send a written notice of the change to the Commissioner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a change of name—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for a movement permit that is a Part VIII paper permit—immediately ensure that the permit is not displayed on the vehicle and, within 72 hours after the change, send the permit to the Commissioner; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for a movement permit that is a Part VIII e-permit—immediately ensure that no printout of the e-permit is displayed on the vehicle. (L.N. 197 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: If the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: receives from the holder of a movement permit—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a notice of a change of name under subregulation (6); and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the permit is a Part VIII paper permit—the permit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is satisfied that the change has occurred,

subsection.continued: the Commissioner may issue an amended movement permit to the holder. (L.N. 197 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—
subsection.def: area where boothless tolling applies (無亭收費區域) means—(a)a boothless mode tunnel as defined by section 2(1) of the Road Tunnels (Government) Ordinance (Cap. 368); or(b)the toll area operated in boothless mode as defined by section 2(1) of the Tsing Sha Control Area Ordinance (Cap. 594). (20 of 2021 s. 91)

section.name: s54
section.heading: Long load permits and wide load permits
section.content: The Commissioner may, on an application in a form specified by him and on receipt of the long load permit fee or wide load permit fee prescribed in Schedule 2, issue a long load permit or wide load permit subject to such terms and conditions, and valid for such period, as he thinks fit authorizing a goods vehicle to be driven with a load projecting to the front or the rear, or to either side beyond the body of the vehicle, as the case may be.

subsection.content: A Part VIII permit must be issued in a form specified by the Commissioner and must contain the relevant particulars prescribed in Schedule 9.
A Part VIII permit is only effective while it is displayed on the front of the vehicle as near as possible to the vehicle licence displayed in accordance with regulation 25.

For a Part VIII permit issued in respect of a vehicle that is a Part VIII e-permit, while a proper printout of the e-permit is displayed on the vehicle, the printout is deemed to be the original Part VIII permit. (L.N. 197 of 2022)

For a receipt in the form of an electronic record that is deemed to be a valid Part VIII permit for a vehicle pursuant to regulation 59(6), while a clearly legible printout of the receipt (that conforms to the specifications specified by the Commissioner in the receipt) is displayed on the vehicle, the printout is deemed to be the original receipt. (L.N. 197 of 2022)

section.name: s57
section.heading: Cancellation of trade licences and permits

subsection.content: Where any condition of a trade licence or Part VIII permit is contravened, the Commissioner may, by giving notice in writing to the holder of the licence or permit at the address provided in the application for the licence or permit or at the holder’s address last known to the Commissioner (or in the case of a goods permit, excess passengers permit, long load permit or wide load permit by giving notice in writing to the person to whom it was issued), cancel the trade licence or permit, whether or not any person is or will be prosecuted for an offence under regulation 60(1). (L.N. 262 of 1984; L.N. 88 of 2012; L.N. 197 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: If a trade licence is cancelled under subregulation (1), the holder of the licence must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: immediately ensure that the licence is not displayed on any vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: return the licence to the Commissioner. (L.N. 197 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: If a Part VIII permit issued in respect of a vehicle is cancelled under subregulation (1), the holder of the permit must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a Part VIII paper permit—

subparagraph.content: immediately ensure that the permit is not displayed on the vehicle; and
return the permit to the Commissioner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a Part VIII e-permit—immediately ensure that no printout of the e-permit is displayed on the vehicle. (L.N. 197 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: A police officer or any other officer authorized by the Commissioner may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: seize—

subparagraph.content: a cancelled trade licence and any trade plate relating to the licence;
a cancelled Part VIII paper permit; or
a printout of a cancelled Part VIII e-permit issued in respect of a vehicle that is displayed on the vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purpose of the seizure, detach the licence, plate, paper permit or printout from a vehicle. (L.N. 197 of 2022)

section.name: s58
section.heading: Waiving or refund of fees
section.content: The Commissioner in his absolute discretion may waive the payment of any fee payable, or refund any fee paid, under these regulations in respect of a motor vehicle, the property of a government other than the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, temporarily brought into Hong Kong for a period not exceeding 4 weeks for the use of an accredited representative of such government while it is so used.

section.name: s58A
section.heading: Fee for advertising vehicle permits
section.content: The fee for issuing an advertising vehicle permit under section 52A of the Ordinance shall be the fee prescribed in Schedule 2.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registration document is lost, destroyed or defaced; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a vehicle licence is lost, destroyed or defaced, or the figures or the particulars thereof become illegible,

subsection.continued: the registered owner of the vehicle may apply to the Commissioner in a form specified by the Commissioner for a duplicate registration document or vehicle licence, and the Commissioner upon being satisfied as to such loss, destruction, defacement or illegibility and upon receipt of any registration document or vehicle licence which has been defaced or is illegible, shall issue a duplicate registration document or vehicle licence, marked as such, on payment of the appropriate fee prescribed in Schedule 2 (or without payment of a fee where in the case of a vehicle licence the Commissioner is satisfied that the figures or particulars on it have become illegible through no fault of the registered owner) and the duplicate registration document or vehicle licence so issued shall have the same effect as the original registration document or vehicle licence.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: If an ICP-related document (original document) is lost, destroyed, defaced or damaged—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to whom the original document was issued may apply to the Commissioner in a form specified by the Commissioner for a duplicate of the original document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Commissioner may, on being satisfied as to the loss, destruction, defacement or damage and—

subparagraph.content: if the original document is a paper ICP and is defaced—on receipt of the defaced paper ICP; or
if the original document is a paper registration card and is defaced—on receipt of the defaced paper registration card,

paragraph.continued: issue a duplicate of the original document, marked as such, and the duplicate so issued has the same effect as the original document. (L.N. 170 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: If a trade licence is lost, destroyed or defaced or a Part VIII permit is lost, destroyed, defaced or damaged—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to whom the trade licence or permit was issued may apply to the Commissioner in a form specified by the Commissioner for a duplicate trade licence or Part VIII permit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Commissioner may—

subparagraph.content: on being satisfied as to the loss, destruction, defacement or damage;
in the case of the defacement of a trade licence or Part VIII paper permit—on receipt of the defaced trade licence or defaced Part VIII paper permit; and
on payment of the appropriate fee prescribed in Schedule 2,

paragraph.continued: issue a duplicate trade licence or Part VIII permit marked as such, and the duplicate trade licence or Part VIII permit so issued has the same effect as the original trade licence or Part VIII permit. (L.N. 197 of 2022)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If a certificate of allocation is lost, destroyed or defaced, the personalized registration mark holder may apply to the Commissioner in a form specified by the Commissioner for a duplicate certificate of allocation, and the Commissioner upon being satisfied as to such loss, destruction or defacement and upon receipt of any certificate of allocation which has been defaced, shall issue a duplicate certificate of allocation, marked as such, on payment of the appropriate fee prescribed in Schedule 2 and the duplicate certificate of allocation so issued shall have the same effect as the original certificate of allocation. (25 of 2005 s. 23)

subsection.leadIn: No person may apply for—

paragraph.name: a
